questions.question: What is the formula of the Zn-based coordination polymer synthesized?
questions.answer: [Zn2(Hpbc)2(2,2’-bipy)(H2O)]·H2O

questions.question: What method was used to synthesize Tb3+@Zn-CP?
questions.answer: Postsynthetic modification (PSM) method

questions.question: What is the limit of detection (LOD) for BP using Zn-CP?
How does the luminescence intensity of Zn-CP change upon the addition of BP?
questions.answer: The luminescence intensity of Zn-CP is quenched by BP.

questions.question: What is the main reason for the luminescence quenching of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP by BP?
questions.answer: The main reasons are competitive absorption and static quenching.

questions.question: Is Tb3+@Zn-CP capable of ratiometric luminescence sensing of BP?
questions.answer: Yes, Tb3+@Zn-CP is capable of ratiometric luminescence sensing of BP.

questions.question: What changes occur in the luminescence spectrum of Tb3+@Zn-CP upon the addition of BP?
questions.answer: Both the emissions of H3pbc and Tb3+ ions of Tb3+@Zn-CP simultaneously decrease.

questions.question: Can Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP detect BP in real urine systems?
questions.answer: Yes, both Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP can detect BP in real urine systems.

questions.question: What is the LOD for BP using Tb3+@Zn-CP in a real urine system?
Does the structure of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP remain unchanged after the detection of BP?
questions.answer: Yes, the structures of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP remain unchanged after the detection of BP.

questions.question: What is the response time of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP for BP detection?
questions.answer: The response time is very fast, less than 5 seconds.

questions.question: Can Tb3+@Zn-CP be used as a portable device for detecting BP?
questions.answer: Yes, Tb3+@Zn-CP can be used as a portable device for detecting BP.

questions.question: What is the significance of the uncoordinated –COOH groups in Zn-CP?
questions.answer: The uncoordinated –COOH groups in Zn-CP allow for the introduction of Tb3+ ions through coordinated postsynthetic modification.

questions.question: What is the effect of BP on the color of Tb3+@Zn-CP suspensions under UV light?
questions.answer: The color of Tb3+@Zn-CP suspensions changes from green to colorless upon the addition of BP under UV light.

questions.question: Is the luminescence lifetime of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP significantly affected after sensing BP?
questions.answer: No, the luminescence lifetime of Zn-CP and Tb3+@Zn-CP slightly changes after sensing BP, indicating static quenching.

questions.question: What is the role of competitive absorption in the luminescence quenching mechanism?
questions.answer: Competitive absorption between Zn-CP or Tb3+@Zn-CP and BP contributes to the luminescence quenching.

questions.question: How does the LOD of Zn-CP for BP detection compare to other methods?
questions.answer: The LOD of Zn-CP for BP detection is competitive and comparable with those reported in other methods.

questions.question: Does the incorporation of Tb3+ ions into Zn-CP affect its structure?
questions.answer: No, the incorporation of Tb3+ ions does not destroy the structure of Zn-CP.

questions.question: What is the significance of the dual-emission characteristic of Tb3+@Zn-CP?
questions.answer: The dual-emission characteristic of Tb3+@Zn-CP enables ratiometric luminescence sensing of BP.

questions.question: Can the test papers of Tb3+@Zn-CP visually detect BP under UV light?
questions.answer: Yes, the test papers of Tb3+@Zn-CP can visually detect BP under UV light by showing a color change.
